Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw two students who are trying to communicate over a distance.
The student can include a string telephone in their drawing, showing how it connects the two students.
The student can use labels to indicate that the string telephone uses sound to carry the message over the distance.
The student can depict the materials provided for building the string telephone, such as cups and string.
The student can show how the device allows communication between the students using sound through the string.
The student can illustrate how the string must be taut for sound to travel effectively.
The student can include some notes explaining that the string telephone helps in communication over distances, though these might lack detailed elaboration.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently label all parts fully or accurately (e.g., may forget to label one cup or the string).
The student might show minor gaps in explaining how sound travels through the string, possibly missing the detail that sound vibrations are carried through the taut string.
The student might not clearly indicate that the string must remain taut for effective communication, though they generally understand this concept.
